{"step_by_step_thinking": "Stubbornness is characterized by a strong-willed or determined attitude. A stubborn child is likely to be obstinate, meaning they are likely to resist changes in their behavior or attitudes, and persist in their own ideas or tasks. This is in contrast to being timid (which would suggest shyness or lack of self-confidence), whining (which is more about complaining or showing discontent), or being hysterical (which suggests uncontrolled emotional excess).", "answer_choice": "A"}
